challengeName: CSFV Minisite1 Frontend Application - CMS related pages styling update
detailedRequirements:
Task Overview

The goal of this challenge is to apply the news details page layout/styling to Terms Of Use, About Us, FAQ, and Privacy Policy pages.

Task Requirements

  • The four pages (Terms of User, About Us, FAQ, and Privacy Policy) should have same styling/layout of News Details page.
  • The right side widget should be changed to "Related Topics". It should display the other topics, i.e. if the page is Terms of Use, then related topics would be About Us, FAQ and Privacy Policy. In order to avoid hardcoding, the 4 topics should have a common category other than the one associated with them, and use that category to pull related topics excluding the one we are currently displaying.
  • Remove "View More" button from the right side widget.
  • Comments section, Liking functionality should be working as expected.
  • The main widget title in black header should be same as the CMS post title.
  • Use proper css files to place the css code. It is better to reuse news styling or simply clone same news details jade file to new jade file be used by the 4 CMS Posts. You can name it "policiesandhelp.jade"
  • Cleanup old code/config/jade ..etc

Github Code

Code of csfv_minisite_frontend_module located here https://github.com/topcoderinc/csfv_minisite_frontend_module (this is the minisite frontend application) - use minisite1 branch

Code of csfv_cms_module located here https://github.com/topcoderinc/csfv_cms_module (this is the CMS application used to create the cms posts)

Code of csfv_test_data_generator located here https://github.com/topcoderinc/csfv_test_data_generator (generate test data)

Reference

We already address similar requirements for csfv_frontend_module, refer to that one, study it as we need to do the same as it is done there. The deployment guide located under csfv_frontend_module/docs/readme_to_add_cms_posts.docx (submit similar one in this challenge)
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Deliverables

  • Patch file of the changes.
  • Document explaining how to setup the CMS posts

Final Submission

For each member, the final submission should be uploaded to the Online Review Tool.
